adrFormatAddress: 88 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text:
The Essex Market is fun! Lots of little kiosks with items and flavors from all over the world!
Days are starting to get chillier so I needed to try these two flavors before the weather really starts getting cold.
Taro and matcha flavor- I truly  just wanted to eat really colorful ice cream…
The person working was very nice and patient with my questions because they have flavors I’ve never heard of before like pandan and durian.
It was a nice experience and the price is exactly the same as other specialty ice cream shops in NYC.
I liked walking and eating a fun product as a farewell to an awesome summer. It was a nice moment ❤️

originalText.text: I have had nothing but exceptional experiences at Lower East Side Ice Cream Factory! Every visit has been a delightful adventure into the world of delectable frozen treats. The ice cream here is beyond compare. From the moment I step through the doors, I am greeted with a wide array of mouthwatering flavors, each one carefully crafted to perfection. Whether I'm indulging in their classic favorites or exploring their unique seasonal creations, the taste and quality are consistently outstanding. The people working at Lower East Side Ice Cream Factory are not only decent but also incredibly friendly and accommodating. They go the extra mile to ensure that each customer has a pleasant and enjoyable experience. If you're seeking a place with incredible ice cream and a warm and welcoming atmosphere, look no further than Lower East Side Ice Cream Factory. I highly recommend this gem to all ice cream enthusiasts. It's truly a place where sweet dreams come true!

originalText.text: Extremely rude worker running the counter. They close at 6 and I was at the counter at 5:57.  Can I have a flavor that was on the board. She turned and checked the time on her phone and then she said "no" rudely. Not "sorry we're out" or something similar. She said we only have what's written on the tubs of ice cream. I said ok and looked down to see what they had. As soon as I looked down she said  "you have 2 minutes" in a rude tone. I said forget it since I'm obviously bothering you. There are too many ice cream shops around that want people's business then to ever give this place my money.

originalText.text: I went here today and the ice cream was delicious. I ordered Ube, which is a favorite of mine. Lots of unique flavors. As delicious as it was I am torn as to whether or not it’s worth $6.50 for one scoop. It’s quite pricey if you bring your children. Service was nothing special at all. I’ll go there again because the environment at the Essex market is exceptional and I enjoy being there.

originalText.text: Super good. Has fun flavors like pandan (which is the green one I got as shown in my pic), matcha & cookies, red bean, egg tart aka dan tat, etc. The logo of the dragon and the fun Asian flavors reminds me a lot of Chinatown Ice Crean Factory, so I wonder if they’re by the same management. But would definitely recommend!!!
